During the 1800's people who could build, farm, or invent came to America in ship after ship after ship. And just in time to! With all the new technology in the 1800's there was plenty for them to do. They were neede to work in the new factories, to farm and build on the land, and to invent things. Immigrants did all that.

Germans made up the largest single group of immigrants in 1800's. Next to Germans, the Irish were the largest immigrant group. Before the American Civil War in the 1860's, one-fourth of the whole population of Ireland came to America. (That was 1.7 million Irish men, women, and children.) They kept comong, during and after the war. the Irish were desparate because in Irelandd crops have failed, espicially the potatoe crop. There was a food shortage. More than 1 million people died of starvation in Ireland.

In the later 1800's, people started coming from other European countries that had not sent so many people to America before. This included Russia, Italy, Poland, Denmark, Sweden and Hungary. The population of Europe doubled between 1750 and 1850. All those extra people needed homes, food, jobs-and there just didnt seem to be enough of them in Europe. Many Europeans came to America to find work and to avoid hungar.

Others came for religious freedom. These include people from Holland and Jews that came from Germany, Poland, and Russia.(Jews were often mistreated for there beliefs in there home countries.) Still others came to escape wars that made life unstable and unpredictable.

In total, some 26 million immigrants arrived in the United States over a 50 year peroid. Think about that, 26 million!. most of the newcomers knew very litttle about America except that it was a land of freedom. But thats what they wanted: freedom and a chance to work.

Immigration to the United States

In the l800s, millions of people immigrated to America. Among them were the Germans, the largest single group of immigrants. The Irish were next to the Germans, with one-fourth of the population, or 1.7 million people, moved to the United States because crops had failed.

 

In the later 1800s, people started to come in from other European countries, like Russia and Poland. Many Europeans came to America to avoid hunger and find work.

 

Others, like the people from Holland and Jews from Germany and Russia came for religious freedom. The Jews came to escape prejudice. Still other people came to escape wars. Southern Italians suffered from high birth rate and farming losses. The tradition of leaving land to the oldest son meant that younger siblings were left landless, and often came here looking for opportunities.

 

Many reasons that people came to America was that they had a harsh environment, wars, other conflicts, and poverty that forced people over. People willingly came to find jobs, wealth, opportunities, and perceived freedoms.

 

The Chinese came here hoping to find riches in Californian hills. Most of these Chinese were from Guangdong, on China's south coast. There were many rebellions against the government, and endless village and family feuds. The government raised taxes, forcing farmers unable to pay them to sell their land. The area couldn't produce enough rice to feed its growing population.

 

Between 1860 and 1910, the population almost tripled! Almost 7 times more people lived in cities, and coal production increased twenty-fold. We got 8 times more miles of railroad track, and about six times the amount of newspapers. These numbers show that the population of America is growing.

It's been hard to suvive in the poverty my family and I live in, it's hard to look at the people who get it so easy and yet we still struggle with the little that we have, but then again I am thankful we have the small amount we do, it's better than nothing and makes me realize that I should be happy that I'm not on the street.

 

My brother has always woked hard in the feilds to provide us with food and water even though we dont really have enough to be completely healthy, by the time he gets home my mother and I are asleep but sometimes she stays up and waits for him cause shes afraid he will get hurt like my father did, it was pitch black outside in the cold night it was almost 1:30 am and mom was getting worried cause he usually comes home at 12 the next morning his soft voice did'nt linger in to my room to wake me on the news he had been killed and his wallet was stollen, the man who killed my father is in prison now, but i send him letters not being rude, just asking why.

 

It's morning, I awake and see my brother standing over me and he told me that breakfast was ready so I ran downstairs and looked but there was nothing on the table except crumbs of bread from last nights dinner, he told me we were gonna eat outside which we had'nt done for a while, we never went to school we were to poor but my mom taught me some stuff.

 

At a young age I was taught how to hunt animals and use every little bit of them so none would go to waste, I also learned how to cook from my dad at an early age, such a shame that the man shot him down, would've been nice for him to be around but everything has it's reasons.

 

 

All and all we had to work very hard to earn what keeps us alive and even though it was hard back then we still worked through our challenges and made it this far.

Once upon a time there was a little girl who loved learning about different cultures.  That girls name was Mackenzie Hollister.  She was 9 years old and was diagnosed with breast cancer.  When she was 4 years old her mom died of lung cancer.  As the years went by, she started to think that she wanted to die too.  One evening her father got up out of bed.  It was going to be a long day for him.  He had 17 job intereviews to go to.  As he was about to get in his car,He realized that Mackenzie had to go to school.  So he ran back inside woke her up,made sure she was all ready in 10 minutes and left.  As they were in the car on their way to drop Mackenzie off,they saw Tom Brady walking down the street.  They asked him if he needed a ride,so he said yes.  There was a problem though because the car only had 2 seat in it,so the dad pushed Mackenzie out of the car and sai "you can walk to school today,you need the exercise!".  So she walked to school,she was sad.  She had saw all of her friends in their cras with their moms and dads bringing them to school,yet there she was walking down the dark alleys and crossing the busy roads.  When she got to school it was allready 11:00 and they were all having lunch allready!  SHe got so mad that she threw all of her stuff on the ground and said "I'm late for school and people have just forgot all about me?!?!".  She got really mad and decided to take her anger out on someone smaller than her.  So she went up to her friends little sister and punched her!  The little girl cried and cried.  Then the principle came walking down the hall,and said"Mackenzie Hollister I want to see you in my office right not missy!" So Mackenzie walked down to his officer and got kicked out of school.  She did not like that at all!!  So she came back to that school the next day and never told her father what happened.  He father has asked what was going on and how her day was and all she said was "Fine now leave me alone!"  The next day when she went back to school the teachers had locked all the doors and spray paimted on them with black paint.  It said "Mackenzie Hollister is band from this school if we see her on this property we are calling to police!"  One of the teachers looked out the door and saw her standing there so she yelled "what is your problem I did not do anything to you guys for you guys to act like this!",But the teacher did not pay attention!  She just sat there and stared at Mackenzie like she was a crazy salker or something.  SO then that very day as she was walking home she saw a really cute guy!  He looked exactly like Justin Bieber!  She got obsessed with that bot that she decided to follow him to his house.  As the guy turned around to talk to her she realized that was her old teacher Mr.Lewis.  He was stunned to see her following him,so stunned that he asked her if she wanted to come inside!  Mackenzie was so embarressed that her cheeks got all red.  Of course she couldn't deni it though so she said "i would be happy to".  They walked in his house and right away she wanted to leave,she got really bored!  His house was broing! 

   5 months later.....MAckenzie marrys Mr.Lewis...eww! and they have 7 kids! 4 girls and 3 boys their names are :Stephanie Lewis,Kaylee Lewis,Brianna Lewis,Aysia Lewis,Samuel Lewis,Shayne Lewis,Lavontay Lewis!.  THe kids were HANDSOM and GORGOUS!!   THE END!

Mackenzie Hollister was a nice person but she has changed from just a little bit of anger in her!  She could of just done something else instead of hurting someone!!

The reason people moved to America is for many different reasons.One of the reasons was, people from other countries had to leave because of wars, harsh environment, and other life changing conflicts.

 

           In the 1800s European countries (including Russia, Italy, Poland, Denmark, Sweden, and Hungary) came to America because their crops had failed and many people died. Since there were so many people in these countries people needed food, homes, and jobs, so they thought America could have all the things they needed. They also came to America for religious reasons (which included Holland, Germany, Poland, and Russia) like being mistreated for what they believe in and other religious wars as well.

 

             Another reason people came to America was because of easy transportation. Easy transportation meant that people could could take resources (such as silver and lumber) over a long faster distance. It also meant people could escape wars much more quickly with a smaller chance of getting caught by the enemy. Then with new inventions coming out like steam power and the redesign of printing press made it possible to print many inexpensive books and newspaper. However, the invention of the telegraph and telephone made news travel faster and less newspapers were used. Additionally, Russian Jews left to escape prejudice and persecution, in the form of pogroms. Southern Italians suffered from high birth rates and farming losses due to lower prices.

 

        The last reason immigrants came to America was because of the gold!In 1849, 60 ships and thousands of overland travelers were headed for California. 70,000, people came in hope to find the California gold along the American river. The Chinese were fleeing from conflicts and poverty. Guangdong was involved in a war between China and Britain, there were people turning against the government, and endless villages and family feuds. The Chinese government was starting to higher taxes which caused a lot of people to go broke and farmers who couldn't pay their taxes had to sell their land. They also came to America because they didn't have enough food to feed everybody especially when there was floods.

        NUMBER OF PEOPLE IN THE U.S. :

         NUMBER OF PEOPLE WHO LIVE IN CITIES:

             COAL PRODUCTION IN TONS:

1860: 20,471,000           1910: 417,111,000

              MILES OF RAILROAD TRACKS:

1860: 30,626                   1910: 240,293

              NUMBERS OD DAILY NEWSPAPERS:

1860: 387                          1910: 2,600

 

 

        That is why immigrants came to America.

During the 1800s, many people from many countries traveled to America in search of an oppurtunity to have a better life. People were leaving their home countries to come to America with reasons called "pushes" that drive people away from their homes. They then came to America with reasons called "pulls" that attract people to a certain area. Many oppurtunities were provided for immigrants that came to America which greatly increased the population in America.

           One reason that people had for leaving their own countries and moving to America was that advancements in technology provided new jobs and job spaces that needed to be filled. Foreigners saw this as an oppurtunity to start a new life. Workers were needed in factories, for farming and building on the land, and they were needed to invent things. So technically, this area of reason was basically the advancement of technology, the opening of jobs, and access and wealth.

           Not only were people just attracted to the U.S., but they also were repelled from their own countries and displeased with certain things. In Ireland, the potato crop ceased to grow, and many people died of starvation. Some people, though, in order to avoid this, came to America. Some people left their homes because of warfare or poverty.

           As you can see, people had many reasons to immigrate to America. They were either repelled from home, or attracted to America. Many oppurtunities were provided for many people. This shows that America is a great nation.

Immigration has been very important throughout the history of the United States. Immigrants have built some of our largest cities, produced much of our food, and have invented many useful things. However people don't just move to the United States for no reason at all. In fact, there are actually many reasons to why immigrants came to the U.S. especially in the 1800's. They came from all over the world, China to Europe in search of a better life and of course, freedom.

       Many nations in Europe were suffering from poverty and starvation due to the huge increase in population there. When something is driving people from their homes, such as war it is called a "push." Poverty and starvation are not the only things troubling Europe at the time, many Jewish people in European countries were being mistreated very horribly. However the United States had many jobs, homes, land, wealth, opportunities, and freedoms. These are called "pulls." Pulls are features of life that attract people. The United States had many "pulls" and very few "pushes." On the other hand, Europe was the complete opposite. There were so many pushes that many people moved to the United States and became immigrants. Now, they could start new lives as Americans who were finally free from the troubles of Europe.

        One "pull" was in the form of a mineral, a very shiny and valuable kind of mineral. That mineral would be gold, and who wouldn't want something that valuable? In 1848 gold was discovered in California, and the Chinese wanted it, even if it meant moving to the other side of the world. They began traveling to California by boat in the California gold rush. Many came from the Chinese city of Guangdong since they were suffering from many "pushes" such as two wars with Great Britain and poverty. By 1870 63,000 Chinese lived in the United States, 77% of which were in California. Our new immigrants even helped build the Transcontinental railroad over rugged terrain. Hopefully the new Chinese citizens found some gold so that they could start new lives in the state of California.

        Immigrants to the United States came for lots of reasons and came from many places from all over the world. They have played an important role in making the United States what it is today. Without immigration the United States would not be very successful and many people would still be crammed into China and Europe. Immigration has also made the U.S.A a powerful and diverse nation. Millions of the immigrant's lives have been made better with the freedoms and jobs of our wonderful nation.

      The resons why people immigrated to America are sorted into two categories, "pushes" and "pulls". Pushes were things that people didn't like about there country, and made them want to leave. Many countries were experiecing war, poverty, and harsh environment during this time. Some people were treated poorly because of religous reliefs. This made America the perfect place for all of these people to go, a land were they could be free and have a chance to work.

They were originally for transporting goods like silver and lumber, but they could carry people as well! Moving from one place to another become easier and faster! Now immigrants from Europe could take a train write to a boat.A trip that would've taken months was now much shorter with the advancement of trains and steamboats. An it sure did bring in a lot of people!

While reading through some cool articles, I found many facts. They were very interesting and easy visualize. Here are some reasons why people moved to America in the 1800s.

   First of all, People came to America for happy reasons. For example, people moved to work. Working people who could build, farm, or invent came to America very quickly. This was a good thing because they were needed to work in new factories, to farm and build on the land, and to invent things. Their work was very helpful to America.

   Also, people came to America for sad reasons. For example, people living in Europe needed food, shelter, and jobs. Sadly, Europe did not have any of those things for them. It was a very sad situation. Therefore, they came to America to find work and to avoid hunger.

   Finally, people came to America for Industrial reasons. The second half of the 1800s was a time of great change in America. Industry improved lots! For example, transportation improved, and the first railroad crossed the United States in 1869. This made it a lot easier to move silver and lumber from the West to the East. A trip from one place to another made it much easier for immigrants to travel.

   Looking back on these facts, I realize that it was easy for some people to live, but not so easy for others. I have really enjoied reading this information about our country. Those were some reasons why people moved to America in the 1800s.

In the 1800s lots of people immigrated to America. Many people wanted freedom, a job, wealth and to escape a harsh enviorment. You will find out who immigrated to America, why, and the pushes and pulls of immigration.

 

     Who immigrated to America?

         Well, lot of different people from different countries immigrated to America like people from Germany, Ireland, China Russia, Italy, Poland, Denmark, Hungary, Sweden and many more. Out of all of these countries the Germans were the largest immigrant group. People immigrated to America for many reasons like jobs, wealth, opportunities, access to resources and freedom. People also immigrated to America because of hard times in their home land like a bad enviorment, wars or other conflicts and poverty. These are called the "Pushes" and "pulls of immigration.

 

     The Gold Rush.

       The Gold Rush was another reason to immigrate to America, it made jobs and made some people rich. It all started in 1848 when John Sutter discovered gold along the American river in California. He tried to to keep it a secret but soon the word spread throughout the U.S. and to the rest of the world. By January of 1849, thousands of overland travelers and 60 ships were on the way to California. The gold rush had started. More than 70,000 people arrived in California in 1849. Among these people were 325 men from China. More kept on coming in search of a fortune in the California hills.

 

     As you can see in the 1800s lots of immigrants immigrated to the U.S. Between 1860 and 1910 the population of America increased by 60,894,000 people. The 1800s were a key time for the U.S.

My paragraph is about why people immigrated to America from different countries. During the 1800s, people in other countries who could build, farm, or invent came to America in ships. The single Largest group was the Germans. Next to them were the Irish. Before the Civil War in the 1860s one fourth of the whole population of Ireland came to the US. The Irish were desperate because Ireland crops were failing and there was a food shortage and more than 1 million people died of starvation.

 

In the later 1800s, more people from Europe started immigrating to America. The population in Europe doubled between 1750 and 1850. All of those extra people needed food, jobs, and homes. But there just didn't seem to be enough in Europe. Many came to the United States to escape hunger and to hopefully find work.

 

Others came for religious freedom. These included immigrants from Holland, and Jewish people from Germany, Poland, and Russia.(Jews were often mistreated for their beliefs.) Others came to escape wars that just made life too unstable and unpredictable. In total, 26 million immigrants came over to America in a 50 year period.

 

Sources: A History of Us. Hakim, Joy. A History of Us. Reconstruction and Reform 1865-1870. Book 7. (New York: Oxford University Press, 1994 or 1999) pgs. 111, 113, 115.

In the 1800s, people from europe and other countries migrated to America. They sailed across the sea to get there.

 

 The largest single group was the Germans and next to the Germans, the Irish were the largest group. Before the American Civil War, 1.7 million Irish men, woman, and children moved to America. They were moving there because their crops have died out. They were trying to get away from starvation in Ireland. About 1 million people died of starvation there.

 

 Later in the 1800s, people from Russia, Italy, Poland, Denmark, Sweden, Hungary, and other places started travling from other European countries that had not sent that many people to America before. The population doubled between 1750 and 1850. They all needed homes, jobs, and homes. They came to America to avoid hunger and find work.

 

 Others came for freedom. That included people from Holland, and Jews who came from Russia, Germany, and Poland. Others still came to escape wars.

 

 The second half of the 1800 hundreds was a great increase in America. Many immigrants came on America's shores. Travelers could catch a train that took them right to a boat. The boat traveled faster now then before.

 

 More people came aware of the world around them and the ability to move along distances easily, they moved more than before. The moved because of "pushes" and "pulls." Pushes were features of life that moved people away from their homes. Pulls are features of life that attract people.

 

 Gold was discovered in 1848 along the American River in California. Hundreds of people left the city and went off to the American River in San Francisco. By January of 1849, thousands of overland travelers and 60 ships were heading for California. The gold rush had begun.

 

The first immigrants from China were from Guangdong. In the middle of the 1800s, Guangdong had two wars between China and Britain. There were also rebellions against the government. The Chinese government raised taxes, but the farmers were unable to pay. They had to sell their land.

 

People felt hopeless. They listened to tales of gold beyond the Pacific Ocean. They called it Gam Saan or "Gold Moutain." They made their fortunes and returned to China.

 

The good news about that was many people China heard about it and wanted to join the gold rush. There was 325 Chinese who joined the gold rush in 1849. When it was just beginning. 450 more Chinese arrived the next year. Suddenly they came in greater numbers such as 2,716 in 1851, and 20,026 in 1852. In 1870 there were about 63,000 Chinese in the US. Although they could be found throughout the country most of them were in California.

By Brieonni Johnson

Chinese: Many Chinese people traveled to America to escape poverty and gain fortune. Mainly, because there was the Gold Rush running around in California (which they called Gam Saan). China was raising taxes impossible for the people to pay and their crops were growing too low to even come close to the pay, so they had no other choice than to go to to America.

Last, but not least, the people who came for religious freedom.

Russian Jews: Due to the war against Jews, and wars made by the famous and Terrible Hitler. The Jews ran away in order to survive, and came to America.

In my country, there is currently poverty and war.  Things aren't gong well for my family. We don't have any jobs, or any money. Life is getting hard, and we don't have much time.  If we don't act soon, famine will soon come.  We are running out of time. Going to America will hopefully help us out with all of these problems.  So I'm going to take my family there.

 

When we were traveling, I noticed it was taking awhile to make progress on the trip.  It was really crowded with other families and cargo.  There were what seemed like huge family's trying to bring almost everything they owned because they could not bear the leaving their valuables behind.  I almost thought the ship would sink because there were so many people and cargo.  But, we were getting there.

 

Arriving at America was amazing, but also sad because we had just left our country where we grew up behind.  We were also confused with how many cultures were in America. There was a lot more freedom there than I could ever imagine.  We walked around and saw many worship places like churches.  The only step left was to get a job, and find a home.

 

Finding a job wasn't that hard; in fact it was very easy.  The only problem... I couldn't find a home.  My job payed well, but not well enough to find a home.  Instead, we found a homeless shelter. We slept their and ate very little, but this was better than the previous. 

 

Looking back on the decision now, makes me proud. I know I could have done better, but we made it.  I personally think it was a good idea.  Life is better now that I've emigrated.  I really wouldn't do anything different!

Many people immigrate to a different country for several different reasons.  Although, most of the time it is because of push and pull factors.  A push factor is when you are driven out of you home for various reason.  A pull factor is when you are pulled out of your home, often it is because greater things await.

 

Lots of people have to leave their country because of push factors.  An example of a push factor is wars. Some people do not like being around fighting so they often move so they do not have to deal with that.  Also, people often move because of religious freedom. In some countries, they make their people believe in only on thing, but sometime people have different beliefs, so the move so they are able to believe in what the want.  Some people move because of harsh enviorments.  Sometimes there is often random bombings, or shootings, and they are feel like they are in danger. Most times, people move because there is alot of poverty in their area, so they move to try and get jobs and money.  Often, there is a famine, therefore they have to move to be able to get food.

 

Several people move to a different county because of pull factors.  One example of a pull factor is that ther might be more or better jobs here in America.  Some people may be unhappy with their job in there old county so they move to find a better one.  Other people move because they will have lots of resources, such as food, water, and many other things.  Sometime it is even educational resoures.  Lots of people move because of the California Gold Rush. During that time, people were hoping to find gold and strike it rich!

 

Other times, people move just because they want to experience an adventure. They might want to start a new life with different people, in a different country!  They may be tired of doing the same things everyday, so they move to be able to change their lives and try somthing different! People often move so they can go to collage in a different country.  They often want to experience going to a school in a different country.

 

In conclusion, people move to different countries for lots of different reasons!  Weither it may be to get out of a bad situation, or to go to school, or even to get a better job, American will always be here with its arms wide open!

During the 1800s, working people who could build, farm, or invent came to America in ship after ship after ship. With all the new technology in the 1800s there was plenty for them to do. They were needed to work in the new factories, to farm and build on the land, and to invent things. Immigrants did all that.

 

Germans made up the largest single group of immigrants in the 1800s. Next to the Germans, the Irish were the largest immigrant group. Before the American Civil War in the 1860s, one fourth of the whole population of Ireland came to America. ( That was 1.7 million Irish men, women, and children)

 

Gold was discovered in 1848 along the American River in California, on property of a man named John Sutter. Although Sutter tried to keep the discovery a secret, word of the find soon reached San Francisco, and hundreds of people left the city to set off for the American River.

 

The second half of the 1800s was a time of great change in America. Industry grew and many immigrants arrived on America's shores. Transportation improved. The first railroad that crossed the United States was completed in 1869. This meant that it became easier and easier to move resources like silver and lumber from the West to the East.

 

In conclusion, the 1800s was a hard working time for all. In total, 26 million immigrants arrived in the United States over a 50 year period. Think about that 26 million!

In 1800s, citizens from the country of Europe immigrated to the United States in hopes to find freedom, jobs, homes, and food. Others immigrated from China in order to be involved in the California Gold Rush. There are several different reasons as to why people came to the United States.

 

     Russian Jews came to America to have religious freedom. Jews left to escape prejudice and the harsh persecution and the violent attacks. They, along with many others from the European continent, were also sick of the harsh conditions that Europe had to offer. Everyone seemed to want to escape the hunger, unpredictable war outbursts, and of course having no control over yourself or desicions.

 

     The Irish came to America to try and pry themselves out of the food shortage in their home country. They were willing to work wherever just to have a nice, hot meal in order to survive. Migrating to America seemed to be the only smart idea at the time for them, because everyone knew America was the free land that seemed to have everything in one's wildest dreams. Irish families were willing to do anything as long as it meant surviving, and if that meant going to America, then so be it.

 

     Lastly, the immigrants of China got word the gold had been discovered along the American River in the great, sunny state of California in 1848. The Chinease decided the wanted to be in on the action, along with being free citizens, so, in 1849, various Chinease people jumped on one of 60 ships that were heading toward good ol' California. A little over 70,000 greatful adventurers arrived in California in 1849, also nicknamed the "Forty-Niners". In the huge group of "Forty-Niners", consisted of 325 men from China, but the following year, California would expect more from China to arrive. The Chinease wanted to find fortune, as well as the others, to provide for themselves.

  People move to America for a lot of reasons. Polish people came because they could get religious freedom. Irish people came because the were having a food shortage. Flemish people came for religious freedom too. A lot of people came, in total 26 million!

During the 1800's, working people who could build, farm, or invent came to America in ship after ship. With all the new technology in the 1800's there were plenty for them to do. They were needed to work in the new factories, to farm and build land, and to invent things. Immigrants did all that.

     People became more aware of the world around them and with the ability to move long distances easily, the moved more than ever than before. the reasons they moved often characterized "pushes" and ''pulls.'' Pushes are those features of life that drive people from their homes. These include a harsh enviroment, wars and other conflicts, and poverty. Many of these push elements were made worse by a rapid increase in the number of people in Europe. Pulls are those features of life that attract people. These include jobs, wealth, acsess to recources, and perceived freedom.

People moved to America in the 1800s for a number of reasons. For one, people came for more money and better jobs. The United States had advanced in technology, so people could invent new things. They could also build or farm. Ship after ship came to America, all carrying people that wanted a better life.

 

     Another reason for so many people coming to America was that people were starving in their home countries. One example is Ireland. When their crops (especially potatoes) failed, over 1 million of Ireland's people died of starvation. As a result, 1.7 million Irish men, women, and children came to America.

 

     People also moved to America for religious freedom. People in Holland, Poland, Russia, and some Jews from Germany, were all being treated unfairly for their religion. Other people came to escape wars that made life uneasy.

 

     Other times people were pushed out of their country because of harsh environment, war, and poverty. Some were pulled by things that attracted them. These pulls included jobs, wealth (gold, etc.), new opportunities, access to resources, and freedom.

 

     Population increased wildly throughout America. In 1860, the population was 31,513,000; but in 1910, the population was 92,407,000. Over a time period of 70 years, the population increased by 30,894,000 people! And that is why people moved to America in the 1800s.

Many immagrants came to America during the 1800s. Chinese, Irish, and even Europians. So, in the following paragraphs, I will explain how and why these immagrants came to America.

 

      During the early 1800s, Germans had one of the largest population at the time. After the Germans was the Ireland. But soon, the population of Ireland decreased and America's population increased. The reason that this happened was because food was dying in Ireland, especially the potato crop. So, while  that happened, America's population increased and soon caused industries to hire more people and farms had more foods to crop. Eventually, Europe began to do the same thing and more people moved to Europe. Between 1750 and 1850, Europe's population doubled and Europe just flerished. Around the 1860s, that all changed. About 26 million of the Europians moved to America.

 

      That year, the first railroad tracks were finished which meant more people could get across America and gold and silver could be taken to the East from the West. After this phenemonon, steam boats were invented more people could travel faster. Sadly, Europe built their railroads and had steamboats to. Soon, in the mid 1800s, a rapid change in transportation happen. Steam powered machines began and a new, redesigned printing press made newspapers possible for more people. Also, inexpensive books were beginning to be made. Eventually, more people around the world became more aware and had the ability of moving long distances. Once people in Europe heard this, people wanted to leave Europe's harsh treatment and go to America. Immagrants soon came to America to make a new life and have families in the United States.

 

       Once it became the year of 1848, a man named John Sutter. He was walking along the river and saw something in the water. He picked it up and saw that it was gold. He tried to keep it a secret but the word got out. Soon, it was all over the United States. Then, It was heard around the world. Eventually, it was heard in China. Once they heard about it, they all wanted to come to what they called "the Gold Mountain". The reason they wanted to go to "the Gold Mountain" was because many farmers and Chinese people had to pay taxes. So, if people went to America and came back with gold, they'd be able to pay their taxes and be proud of it. Once this happened, not many farmers were still there and many starved from the little food that farmers have grown. Another problem was that a flood could cause all the crops to flood and die causing starvation for the people. While this crisis was happening in China, about 63,000 Chinese went to America to mine for gold. At the end of the gold rush, about 77 percent of the Chinese were in America.

Why People Moved to America During the 19th Century

 

During the 1800s, people from all over the world came to America for a better life, or to find riches and become wealthy. Not everyone who came to America had the same purpose of why they came. They all had different reasons. What you are about to read lists a few of the different reasons why people came to America. Whether it be freedom, wealth, or just because they like it here.

        Germans made up the largest single group of immigrants in the 1800s. After that were the Irish. They were the largest of all. Before the Civil War in the 1860s, one-fourth of the population of Ireland immigrated to the US. That's about 1.7 million Irish women, men, and children. They came during and after the war. The Irish people left because the crop in Ireland failed, especially the potato. There was food shortage, and more than 1 million people died of starvation in Ireland.

         In the late 1800s, people started coming from other European countries that had not sent many people to America earlier. A few countries included Denmark, Sweden, Italy, Poland, Hungary, and Russia. Between 1750 and 1850, the population in Europe had doubled. This meant that all those extra people needed food, jobs, and homes-but there just didn't seem to be enough for everyone. Many Europeans came to America to find work and avoid starvation.

         Others came for religious freedom. Some people came from Holland, and Jews who came from Germany, Poland, and Russia. The Jews were often mistreated for their beliefs in their homeland. Others came to escape wars that made life miserable and unpredictable.

         Overall, about 26 million immigrants came to America in a 50 year time period.

 

         The "Part 2" of the 1800s was a time of a great boost in technology for America. Industries grew, and many immigrants came for work. The first railroad that crossed the US was completed in 1869, making it easier to transport cargo and people to other places. Steamships were also invented, making a trip to America faster than before. The telephone and telegraph both helped news travel faster between people.

         People became more aware of the world they lived in because of these inventions. The redesign of the printing press allowed cheaper books and newspapers to be printed, allowing even more news and ideas to reach the common people.

         In the 1800s, there were two types of immigrants, "Pushes" and "Pulls". Pushes are the features of life that drive people away from their home. These include harsh environment, wars, and other conflicts and poverty. Pulls are the features in life that attract people. These include jobs, wealth, opportunities, access to resources, and freedom.

         Many of the people in Europe left because of harsh conditions. Russian Jews left to escape prejudice and persecution in the form of pogroms-organized attacks. Southern Italians struggled with high birth rates and farming due to lower prices. Hungarians, Poles, Greeks, Armenians, and Portuguese also moved to America in search of a happier and safer lifestyle for them.

 

         When gold was discovered in 1848 along the American River in California, excitement exploded all around the world. By January of 1849, almost 60 ships and thousands of land travelers were headed for San Francisco. This event is known as the Gold Rush.

          There were about 70,000 hopeful miners who arrived in 1849. These people are called the Forty-Niners. Among them were about 325 Chinese immigrants. More and more Chinese came flooding to California year after year. Like everyone else, they were hoping to get lucky and find gold.

          Most of the first wave of Chinese immigrants came from Guangdong, China. These Chinese people came not only for fortune, but to escape poverty and conflicts. Guangdong was involved in two wars between China and Britain. Many rebellions and infinite village and family fights left Chinese people with a dream that things will get better. They saw the Gold Rush as an opportunity to escape all the drama going on where they lived. In fact, the Chinese people even gave California a special name-Gam Saan, or Gold Mountain. They wanted to go there, find riches, and come home with pride.

 

          The 325 Chinese who joined the Gold Rush in 1849 was only the start. In 1850, 450 more Chinese showed up in California. The numbers increased until there were more than 63,000 Chinese living in America. That's a pretty big number, which is why they even founded a Chinese community. Today, it is known as China-Town. The Chinese played a very important role in building the first transcontinental railroad. Although Chinese people can be found throughout America, about 77% of them lived in California.

Immigrating to the United States

 

 


Moving to America

      In the 1800s, people started coming from other European countries that had not sent many people to America before.  This included Russia, Italy, Poland, Denmark, Sweden, and Hungary.  In total, some 26 million immigrants arrived in the United States over a 50 year period.  Most newcomers new very little about America except that it was a land of freedom.  But that's what they wanted: freedom and a chance to work.
 

 


Changing in America: The "Pushes" and "Pulls" for Immigrants

      People became more aware of the world around them and with the ability to move long distances easily, they moved more than ever before.  The reasons they moved are characterized as "pushes" and "pulls". Pushes are those features of life that drive people from their homes.  These include harsh environment, wars and other conflicts, and poverty.  Many of these push elements were made worse by rapid increase in the number of people in Europe.  Pulls are those features that attract people.  These include jobs, wealth, opportunities, access to resources, and perceived freedoms.

      Many of the new European immigrants wanted to escape harsh conditions in Europe.Russian Jews left to escape prejudice and persecution , in the form of pogroms-organized violent attacks.  Immigrants hoped to make a new life for themselves and their families in the United States.

 



Gold Rush! Chinese Move to California

      Gold was discovered in 1884 along the

American River in California, on the poverty of a man name John Sutter.  Although Sutter tried to keep the discovery a secret, word of the find soon reached San Francisco, and hundreds of  people left the city to set off for the American River.  The new spread to the rest of the United States, and to other parts of the world as well. 

 

      More than 70,000 hopeful adventurers arrived in California in 1849.  Among these "Forty- Niners" were 325 men from China.  More Chines came the next year, and the next. Like many others who came from the eastern United States, The Chinese hoped to find a fortune waiting for them in the California hills.

 

      Most Chinese migrants came from Guangdong, an area on China's south coast.  They were fleeing fro, conflicts and poverty.  People felt hopeless and they listened closely to tales of gold beyond the Pacific Ocean.  They called California "Gold Mountain", or Gam Saan (in Chinese).  To them it seemed a land of unbelievable treasures and richness.  They long to go there and make their fortunes, and return proudly to China.

 

      The exciting news about Gold Mountain spread through China.  Many people wanted to join the Gold rush.

 

      The 325 Chinese who joined the Gold Rush in 1849 were just the beginning.  The next year 450 more Chinese arrived in California.  Then suddenly they came in greater numbers: 2,716 in 1851, and 20,026 in 1852.  By1870 there were 63,00 Chinese in the United States, and they had played a critical part in building the first transcontinental railroad.  Although they could be found throughout the country, 77% of them were in California.

 

 

      Although immigrating to America was a difficult journey in the 1800s, many people uprooted themselves and moved here.

During the 1800's, thousands of immigrants from all over Europe came to America. These people were looking for many things, including jobs, gold, freedom, food, or homes. With all the new technology, and growing industry, there was plenty for them to do.

 

In the later 1800's, people from Russia, Hungary, Sweden, Denmark, Italy, and Poland came looking for homes, food, and work, many came to avoid hunger. People from Holland, Poland, Russia, and Jews from Germany came for religious freedom, and still many others came to escape the wars that were making their lives unstable and unpredictable. Before the American Civil War in the 1860's, one-fourth of the entire population of Ireland came to America. In Ireland the crops had failed, especially the potato crop, and more than one million people died of starvation in Ireland. The Irish kept coming to America, during and after the war.

 

Russian Jews came to America to escape prejudice and persecution, southern IItalians suffered from high birth rates and farming losses due to lower prices. Hungarians, Greeks, Poles, Portuguese, and Armenians also moved. These immigrants were desperate for help in the U.S.

 

Guangdong, an area on China's south coast was involved in two wars between China and Britain. This led to many rebellions against the government and endless village and family fights. The Chinese government raised taxes, farmers who were unable to pay their taxes had to sell their land. The area could not produce enough rice to feed it's people, so when the Chinese heard about the gold rush in California, they were desperate, and 325 Chinese came to take part in 1849.

 

These iimmigrants from all over the world came to America with many things in common, a need for freedom, food, work, and to make their lives better.

They helped build America, and were able to work in factories, to farm, and had religious freedoms, and became inventors. I can conclude that the 1800's was a great time for these immigrants to arrive in America and have their needs fulfilled.

Why people moved to America                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          

        "Woooohooooo! Everybody we're in America!" the captain shouted after arriving at America. People moved to America after finding out that there was gold in California. John Sutter was the first to find gold on the American River. Many people went to California to look for gold. They would rush there before all of it was gone. Millions of people were present in California looking for gold. There were many farmers who could not pay for taxes so they had to sell their farms. This would've been the perfect time for them to earn some money.

        "Come on! We must hurry to California. There is gold waiting for us," Captain Benjamin Arlington told his crew. They were a poor family that was looking for a way to earn money. They have been poor their whole life and this was the perfect time for them. They were a British family and had little money to pay for taxes.

        The family rushed to the California gold rush and claimed a spot to dig. Captain Ben searched for gold morning and night. The 2 children and a mother tried to find a place to work.

        "Momma, why won't any body accept you for a job? I am tired and hungry," the youngest of the children asked. heir mother did not answer. She just continued walking and asking people if she can have a job. All of the answers were no. They just remembered about their father. They wanted to tell their mother, but they were scared that she wasn't going to answer. Finally, when she was about done asking for jobs, she remembered about Ben.

        "Ohhhh Noooo! We forgot about your father. We have to go and find him. What if he is hurt? Who is going to help him. We have to hurry back to him,"their mother said. They rushed back as quick as they could. They found him and asked how much gold he had found.

        "I found 32 ounces. This might be enough to buy whatever we want to. Do you guys want me to keep looking or should we go home?" Captain Ben told his family.

        "We should go home now. I am hungry and tired. I think you can't find anymore anyway," the oldest child said. The family went to the dock and sailed back to Britain. They could now afford to pay taxes. 

        Most families like the Arlington family traveled to America just to get money. The family got back to Britain and never had trouble paying anything anymore.

Immigration

 

Many people all around the world immigrated for many different reasons. Some people immigrated because of "push" and "pull" reasons. "Push" reasons are when somebody is forced, or driven from their home. "Pull" reasons are when there are new, better opportunities in other countries that could better your life. Wether for either of these reasons, immigration in the 1800's was very interesting.

 

Many people from Ireland (in fact, over 1.7 million, or one fourth of the population) came to America for "push" reasons. These people from Ireland had to come in order to have food. Back in their home country, Ireland, these people were going through starvation. Over 1 million people had already died from starvation there. A new group of immigrants came from many different European countries. These people had to find jobs, food, and homes. There didn't seem to be enough of these things back in their home countries.

 

People from many different continents all over the world had come to America because of "pull" reasons. In the 1800's, people had immigrated to America in hope of becoming rich during California's Gold Rush. By 1849, more than 70,000 "Forty-Niners" had immigrated to America. You'd probably be surprised to find out that most of these people were from China. Although many people were unlucky, and didn't find gold, these people were important in molding America's history.

Immigration                                                                                                             America  has a rich, diverse culture. During the 1800s, people could farm, invent, or build came to America in ships. Those people were immigrants. People in America had plenty to do such as working in a factory, farming, building, or inventing. The Germans were the largest group of immigrants in the 1800s. The Irish were the second largest group of immigrants. Before the the American Civil War in the 1860s, 25% of the entire of population of Ireland came to America. Altogether, that is 1.7 million men, women, and children from Ireland came to America. The Irish were desperate because the crops failed, especially the potatoes. That led to a food shortage so that caused more than 1 million people to die of starvation in Ireland.

  Later, other countries sent people to America that didn't usually send people there. These countries include: Russia, Italy, Poland, Denmark, Sweden, and Hungary. Europe's population doubled in between 1750 and 1850. The people needed food, homes, and work. It didn't seem like there was enough food, homes, or jobs in Europe so many of them moved to America to avoid starvation and to find a job.

  Others came to America seeking religious freedom. Jews were often mistreated for their beliefs in their home countries. Others came to escape wars. Altogether, around 26 million immigrants came to America in only 50 years! Once the first railroad that crossed the United States was completed, transporting goods and people became faster and easier.

  Steam power and the printing press allowed people to print inexpensive books and newspapers which allowed people to spread news faster. People sometimes came to America to escape pogroms-or organized violent attacks. Others wanted to make a new life for themselves and their families.

  A man named John Sutter found gold in California and tried to keep it a secret but word spread to San Fransisco so hundreds of people headed for California in hopes of finding gold. More than 70,000 people came to California in 1849. 325 of these "Forty-Niners" were from China. More Chinese men came the next year,and the next. The Chinese hoped to find a fortune in the California hills because they were fleeing from conflicts and poverty.

By 1870, there were 63,000 Chinese in the United States that all played a part in building the first transcontinental railroad.

By 1860, there were 31,513,000 people in the U.S. America has a rich history and it is a free country. That is why America has a rich and diverse culture.

During the 1800s, immigrants from many places immigrated to America. Many came hoping to have a better life. The reasons for coming to America is different for all the immigrants.

     The Germans were the largest group of immigrants to immigrate to America. The second largest group of immigrants were the Irish. The Irish came to America because they were suffering a famine back in Ireland. The Irish were desperate for a better life, so the Irish immigrated to America. Soon after, people started coming from other countries. The southern Italians experienced high birth rates and farming decreases due to lower prices. Russia, Italy, Poland, Denmark, Sweden, and Hungary were some of the countries. The people from those countries came because they all needed food, homes, and jobs. Some people from Holland, Germany, Poland, and Russia came to America seeking religious freedom. Jews were constantly mistreated for their religious beliefs. Overall, many came to America so they could escape their dreadful life back at home.

     This sudden increase in America's population was ginormous! 26 million immigrants immigrated to America over a 50 year period. During the second half of the 1800s, even more immigrants arrived!

     The reason for the immigrants coming to America this time was because of the American industry growth. People in America could now import and export products faster. The printing press was able to print books and newspapers which meant news could travel faster. By 1844, the telegraph was invented, and by 1876, the telephone was invented.

     An example of immigrants immigrating because of what they "wanted" is the California gold rush. News of the California gold rush spread throughout the United States. Over 70,000 people came to California seeking for gold in 1849. Many Chinese came the very next year. They were looking for fortune through gold.

     Many Chinese came from Guangdong, China. They wanted to escape conflicts, and poverty. The people of Guangdong were rebelling against the government. The Chinese government raised taxes, and farmers who couldn't pay the taxes had no choice but to sell their land. For this reason, Guangdong couldn't produce enough food to feed its citizens.

     As time passed, more and more Chinese came during the California gold rush. The Chinese played an important part in building the first transcontinental railroad.

     In conclusion, America wouldn't be as diverse and technological if immigrants hadn't arrived. The immigrants were essential in order to accomplish many things in America.

During the 1800s, working people who could build, farm, or invent came to America in ship after ship after ship. They came to America because they were needed to work in the new factories, to farm and build on the land, and to invent things, which immigrants all did. Before the American Civil War in the 1860s, one-fourth of the entire Irish population came to America, which was 1.7 million Irish men, women, and children. They kept coming, during and after the war. They were desperate because in Ireland crops had failed, especially the potato crop. There was a food shortage, and more than 1 million people died of starvation in Ireland. In total, after immigrants from Ireland, Russia, Italy, Poland, Denmark, Sweden, Hungary, Germany, and more came to America, some 26 million immigrants arrived in the United States over a 50 year period!

 

     The second half of the 1800s was a time of great change in America. The first railroad that crossed the U.S. was finished in 1869. A trip from one place to another became shorter and easier for many people. In the 1800s, there was also rapid and important change in how quickly and widely information traveled. The invention of the telegraph in 1844 and telephone in 1876 only made news travel faster.

 

     Gold was discovered in 1848 along the American River in California, on the property of a man named John Sutter. Although he tried to keep the discovery a secret, word of it soon reached San Francisco. Later, the exciting news about Gold Mountain spread throughout China. Many people wanted to join the gold rush.

Did you know that for the last 200 years, people from around the world came to the U.S.? Those people helped create the world as it is today. Many people came for many different reasons. For example, many Chinese people came from 1849 to 1870 for the gold rush. Many people also came for new opportunities. Many people came for jobs, wealth, access to resources and perceived freedoms.

    Many people think of immigration as "push" and "pull." To push means to get kicked out of their homes or country. To pull is to get lured into another country. For example, many European immigrants got pulled into America because they wanted to escape their harsh living conditions. Russian Jews left to escape prejudice and persecution in forms of pogroms (organized violent attacks). Southern Italians suffered from high birth rates and farming losses due to lower crop prices. Hungarians, Greeks, Poles, Portuguese, and Armenians also moved. Immigrants hoped to make a new life for themselves and their families in the U.S.

    Gold was discovered in 1848 along the American River in California, on the property of a man named John Stutter. After a while, word broke out around the world and many people came to California. In 1849, China 325 men came to America. After losing many homes and farms, people from China thought they could become rich if they find gold in America. The next year, 450 more Chinese arrived in California. Then in 1851, 2,716 people came for the gold rush. More and more people came year after year.

    Now you see that many people immigrate, from all around the world. Those people helped make the world as it is today.

        In the second half of the 1800s was a time of great change in America.  Industry grew and many immigrants arrived on America's shores. Transportation also improved and in 1869 the first completed railroad crossed the United States. Transportation became much shorter and easier for many people. Many of the new European immigrants wanted to escape harsh conditions in Europe, and Russian Jews left to escape prejudice and persecution. Immigrants hoped to make a new life for themselves and their families in the United States.

 

Information traveled quickly, especially when gold was discovered in 1848

along the American River in California. The owner of the property where it was found, John Sutter, wanted to keep it a secret, but soon it reached San Francisco, and hundreds of people left to set off for the American River. The news traveled across the United States and to other parts of the world. By January in 1849, ships with thousands of people on board were heading for California. The California gold rush had begun.

 

More than 70,000 hopeful adventurers arrived in California in 1849, most

were Chinese. More Chinese people came year after year. These Chinese people were like the rest, they hoped to find a fortune waiting for them in the California hills.

 

Guangdong, an area on China's south coast, were fleeing from conflicts and

poverty. Guangdong was involved in two wars between China and Britain, and there were also many rebellions against the government, and endless village and family feuds, or fights. The Chinese government raised taxes, farmers who were unable to pay their taxes had to sell their land, Guangdong's population was growing quickly, and the area could not produce enough rice to feed its people, especially when floods often destroyed the crops. People felt hopeless and they listened to tales of gold beyond the Pacific Ocean and called California Gam Saan, or "Gold Mountain." To them it seemed amazing! No. More than amazing. Unbelievable! They dreamed about its unbelievable richness and they longed to go there, make their fortunes, and return proudly to China.

During the 1800s, many people came to America. Many people Emmigrated from Europe to Immigrate to America. If some of them had not, some of us could be living in Europe!

  Germans made up the largest single group of immigrants in the 1800s. The second largest group of immigrants is the Irish. About 25% (1.7 million Irish men,women, and children) of the Irish moved to America before the american civil war in the 1860s, due to the Great Potato Famine which took 1 million Irish lives. They kept coming, during and after the war. The irish were very desperate because the most important crop, Potatos had failed, along with most of the other crops.

  In the later 1800s, people started coming from the other European countries that had not sent many people to America before. These include Russia, Italy, Poland, Denmark, Sweden, and Hungary. This is because between 1750 and 1850 the populations of Europe nearly doubled. There just didn't seem to be enough food, homes, and jobs in Europe for them. In total, some 26 million immigrants arrived in the U.S over a 50 year period. Most of the newcomers knew very little about America except that it was a land of freedom. But that's what they wanted: freedom and a chance to work.

Many new European immigrants wanted to escape harsh conditions in Europe. Russian Jews left to escape prejudice and persecution, in the form of pogroms-organized violent attacks, Southern Italians suffered from high birth rates and farming losses due to lower prices. The traditions of leaving family land to the first-born male often left younger siblings landless. Hungarians, Greeks, Poles, Portuguese, and Armenians also moved. Immigrants hoped to make a new life for themselves and thier families in the U.S.

The Move to America

 

   During the 1800s, many people came to America for many different reasons. These reasons included things in America that attracted people, or "pulls", and things in home countries that people wanted to get away from, or "pushes". People came from all around the world including China, Germany, Poland, and Russia. More than 25 million people came to America during the 1800s.

 

   In the 1800s, people came from all around the world to come to America. People came from countries like Italy, Poland, Russia, Denmark, Sweden, Hungary, and Germany. People came for different reasons. Some people, such as the Jews, came to America because they were being mistreated in their home countries for their beliefs, and they wanted religious freedom. Others came to America to find work, because work may have been hard to find in their home countries. Some people, such as the Europeans, came to America to avoid hunger. However, in the mid-1800s, most people came to California to become rich.

 

   In 1849, gold was found on the property of John Sutter. Once people discovered that there was gold in California, they flooded to California in search for gold. People came from all around the world, but many people came from China. In 1849, only 325 Chinese men were searching for gold in California, but by 1870 there were 63,000 Chinese in the Golden State. Most of the people that came from China came to find gold, but a lot of people came to get away from the Chinese government. At that time, the government had raised taxes and many people were rebelling.

 

   From 1860 to 1910, the population of the U.S. almost tripled. There were many more employees and much more product production. Coal production became 21x more efficient. Railroad tracks became 8x longer. There is no doubt that population grew during the 1800s.

Over a 50 year period, 26 million immigrants arrived in the United States! There were many hardships in their home country, so the people came to America in search of freedom. These people were from Germany, Italy, Ireland, and Russia. They were also from Poland, Denmark, Sweden, Hungary, and China. People came to escape wars, poverty, and prejudice. They also came for wealth and the benefits of living in America.

               Jews from Russia, Germany and Poland came to America in the 1800s. All of them came for religious freedom. In their home countries, Jews were often mistreated for their beliefs. They left to escape prejudice and prosecution. Jews didn't know much about America, but still came. Their home country had pogroms, or organized violent attacks to get rid of the Jews. All they wanted was to make a new life for themselves and their family in the United States.

                   There were many benefits in moving to America in the 1800s. One of the benefits was the industry growth. In 1869, the first railroad was completed. This made it easier to carry goods like lumber and silver. People also traveled on the trains, because the trip was easier and shorter. Information traveled faster due to the new printing press. People were able to print newspapers and inexpensive books. In 1844 the telegraph was invented, and in 1876, the telephone was invented. News and ideas were available to more people.                                                                                          Pushes and pulls were what made the immigrants want to move. The features that attracted people were the pulls. Some pulls were wealth, jobs, and opportunities.Other pulls were access to resources and perceived freedom. The features that drove people away from their homes were pushes. Some pushes included harsh environments and wars. There were also, other conflicts poverty. Due to the rapid increase in the number of people in Europe, the pushes were made worse.

                            There were 4,096,753 immigrants in America, in 1860. In 1910, there were 13,344,545 immigrants in America. All the immigrants came from different countries. They all left for different reasons. What they did have in common though, was that they were strong-willed people. They wanted to have a good life for their family and themselves, without judgement in what they believed in.

The Euoropeans migrated to north america to live a better life. They came here to find jobs, relgious freedom, wealth in mining, peace, and freedom of marrige.

 

They got here by sailing across the Atlantic Ocean. The first person to sail here was Christopher Columbus in 1492. Another one of the first explorers was Waun Ponce Delion of Spain. In the early 1800's, many of the immigrants were Germans, Russians, Italians, Polish, and Hungaians.

Why did people come to the United States? People came for many different reasons. Whether they wanted jobs or wanted freedom. Everyone came for their own reason. They were all suffering and just waiting to get out of that jail cell they called home. Luckily, they found America. The place that answered all of their problems. "Why did they come?" you might ask. Here's why.

 

      There are many different reasons. One of them is: oppurtunities. People were attracted to having oppurtunites. Their own homes didn't have as much oppurtunites as America. America was their hero.

 

     Another reason why people came to America is because they needed jobs. The Irish were desperate for jobs because their crops had failed. They needed to support their family, but how? The answer was simple: America.  How would they get what they needed without jobs? They came to the U.S. for jobs.

 

     In addition, people came to America because they needed food. Without a job, how could they pay for food? In Ireland, more than 1 million people died of starvation. Can imagine that? Having no food is terrible. That's why they came to America.

 

     Furthermore, they came beacuse they wanted freedom. Russian Jews left because of harsh conditions. They hade to escape prejudice and persecution. People discriminated them because of their beliefs. What would they do? Where would they go? They went to America. In America they could wander around without being discriminated. That is why they came.

 

     Lastly, people came because they wanted wealth. People from around the world heard about California and its gold in 1849. They wanted to find gold and become rich. Chinese migrants from Guangdong who couldn't pay for their homes came to America in search for gold. California became known as "The Golden State."

 

     In conclusion, many people came for many diffrerent reasons. For wealth, food, jobs, and oppurtunities. They were all thankful for America, for America had given them so much.

The number if people in the U.S. in 1860 was 31,513,000 between 1860 and 1910 the population increased to 92,407,000! the biggest increase was in coal production (in tons), it went from 20,471,000 to 417,111,000!

Many things contributed to the growth of the population in the U.S. During this time period, the 1800s, there is a significant change in the amount of people,coal production, railroad tracks, and newspapers delivered in the United States.

         During the 1800s, working people who could build, farm, or invent came to America in ship after ship. In the new technology, there was plenty for then to do. Germans were the largest single group of immigrants in the 1800s. Next to the Germans, the Irish were the largest immigrant group. One fourth of the whole population of Ireland came to America (that was 1.7 million Irish people). Later people from Russia, Italy, Poland, Denmark, Sweden, and Hungary came to avoid hunger. Others came for religious freedom.

          The second half of  the 1800s was a time of great change. Industries grew and transportation improved. Once the first rail road was completed, it was easier to move resources and people's trips became shorter and easier. The invention of the telegram and telephone only made news travel even faster. The reasons are characterized as "pushes" and "pulls". Pulls are those features that attract people. They include jobs, wealth, opportunities, access to resources, and perceived freedom. Pushes are those features in life that drive people from their homes. They include harsh environment, wars, conflicts, and poverty.

            Lots of Chinese people moved to California because of the gold rush in 1849. More than 70,000 hopeful adventurers arrived in California in 1849. Among these "Forty-Niners" were 325 men from China. More Chinese came next year, and the next. They hoped to find a fortune waiting for them. The first wave of Chinese came from Guangdong, an area in China's south coast. The Chinese called California Gam Saan or "Gold Mountain." By 1870, there were 63,000 Chinese in the United States.

            As you can see, there were many things that contributed to the growth in population of the U.S. These included, the pushes, the gold rush, the improvement in transportation, and the new technology. This was a significant time period in history because of the huge increase in the population of the United States.

The 1800's was the start of major population and industrial in America. The 3 main reasons the 1800's was the start of major population and industrial growth in America is because people needed to move out of crowded countries escape hunger, gain religious freedom, and to have a chance to get rich.

 

   One reason people move into America was because the countries they were living in were too crowded. The European population had doubled between 1750 and 1850. Europe couldn't handle all the people the had back then. They couldn't proved enough food or jobs for everyone. So, many of them moved to America.

 

   Another reason people moved to America was to gain religious freedom. These people were often some German, Polands, and Russians Jews because they were mistreated in what they believed in by there home country. Russian Jews left to America to escape the risk of pogrom(organized violent attacks).

 

   The last main reason people moved to America was to "strike it rich". In 1849, news about the California Gold Rush spread to China. About 325 Chinese men came to mine for gold. Most of the Chinese came from Guangdong to flee from conficts between China and Britian. At the time, Guangdong was getting too much people and not enough rice, so they moved. Most of them got gold and returned to China.

 

   In conculsion, the 1800's was a time of major population and industrial growth in America. People came to escape crowded countries and hunger, while others came to gain religious freedom. But in the end, The 1800's was a time of change in America.

Gold was discovered in 1848 along the American River in California, on the property of a man named John Sutter. The news spread to the rest of the United States, and to the other parts of the world as well. By January of 1849, 60 ships and thousands of overland travelers were headed to California. The California Gold rush had begun.

Immigrants hoped to make a new life foe themselves and there family in the United States.

Over 60 million people came to the United States between 1860 and 1910. These people came because of hardships in their country, opportunities in America, and of Americas modern technology. The United States is a country that many people immigrated to and this is why.

      Many people immigrated to the United States because of hardships. For example, Russian Jews came from Russia to escape prejudice and persecution, in the form of violent attacks. These people came to America to be safe from harm. In addition, Southern Italians suffered from high birth rates, since the traditions was to give land to their first born son, it left many peoples children landless. These people came to America for their children to have a better life. Also, many Europeans came to America to escape conflict and poverty brought on by over crowding. These people came to America to have a better life for themselves and their children. This is the many hardships immigrants faced before they came to America. 

      In addition to hardships, many people came to America because of opportunities. To show this, people came to America for jobs. Many Europeans came to America to find work, since over crowding in Europe lead to job "shortages". Furthermore, people came to America to avoid hunger. A food shortage in Ireland killed 1 million people from starvation. People used that as a wake up call to move to a better place with more food. Finally, people saw  an opportunity in resources. People packed up their belongings and came to America for more resources for them and their families. A great number of people immigrated to America because of opportunities.

      Finally, people immigrated to America because of the new technology in America. For example, from 1860 to 1910 over 200,000 miles of railroad tracks were layed across America which meant for easy travel . In addition to railroad tracks, Over 2,200 newspaper were delivered daily from 1860 to 1910. People found that new technology and the printing press made it easier to get news in America. Lastly, people came to America because of the new technology in factories. Jobs were needed in these factories and immigrants were ready to work. People came to America to get their hands on this new technology.

      In conclusion, many immigrants came to the United States between 1860 and 1910. The hardships in their own countries "pushed" them here, the opportunities and new technology "pulled" immigrants to come live in America. America was a very promising country to the people between 1860 and 1910.

Today I am going to tell you about immigrants in America, Changes in America, and the Gold Rush.

           First, I am going to be talking about the immigrants in America. During the 1800s, working people who could build, farm, or invent came to America in ship after ship after ship. With all the new technology in the 1800s there was plenty for them to do. Immigrants were needed to work in the new factories, to farm and build on the land, and to invent things. Germans made up the largest single group of immigrants in the 1800s. Irish men, women, and children kept coming, during and after the war. In the later 1800s, people started coming from other European countries that had not sent many people to America before. In total, some 26 million immigrants arrived in the United States over a 50 year period.

              Next, I am going to talk about Changes in America. The second half of the 1800s was time of the great change in America. Industry grew and many immigrants arrived on America's shores. Transportation improved and the first railroad that crossed the United States was completed in 1869. A trip to America in earlier times would have taken months, but the new steamships could make the trip much faster. Steam power and the redesign of the printing press made it possible to print many inexpensive books and newspapers. People became more interested of the world around them and with the ability to travel long distances easily, they moved are more than ever before.

              Finally, I am going to talk about the Gold Rush! Gold was discovered in 1848 along the American River in California, on the property of a man by the name of John Sutter. John tried to keep it a secret but word soon spread to San Francisco, and hundreds of people left the city to set off for the American River. More Chinese came the next year, and the next. Most of this first wave of Chinese migrants came from Guandonb, an area on China's south coast. In the middle of the 1800s, Guangdong was involved in two wars between China and Britain. The Chinese government raised taxes. Farmers who we're unable to pay their taxes had to sell their land. Guangdong's population was growing quickly. The area could not produce enough rice to feed its people, especially when the the floods destroyed the crops.

               In conclusion, the 325 Chinese who joined the gold rush in 1849 were just beginning. The next year, 450 more Chinese arrived in California. Then all of a sudden they became a greater number: 2,716 in 1851 and 20,026 in 1852. Although they could be found throughout the country, 77 percent of them were in California.
