This school is celebrating Cultural Heritage Day by recongnizing the stories of those who immigrated to the United States over the last 200 years.To prepare for this even, the teachers has asked the hole class to design a museum-like display,including photos and articles highlighting important information about different immigrant groups to the United States.

In the 1800's, many people decided to migrate to America. Germans had the largest group of immigrants. The Irish were the second largest group. Other immigrants came from Europe, Russia, Italy, Poland, Denmark, Sweden, and Hungary. Why did they migrate? There were many reasons like shortage of food, better crops, jobs, and freedom. there are many different reasons. Many people wanted to come because of all America had to offer, but some were almost forced. Living conditions in some countries made their lives difficult. To try to improve those conditions, they migrated.

 

In these times, one big thing was farming. People from Ireland mainly migrated due to farming. Many of their crops had failed, especially the potato crop. This was a big deal because if the crops died, then they would have no food for their families. More than 1 million people died of starvation. Before the war in the 1860's, a part of Ireland migrated to America. There was about 1.7 million Irish people at the time. They kept coming during and after the war. Later in the 1800's, European countries started sending people to America. This included Russia, Italy, Poland, Denmark, Sweden, and Hungary. Before they migrated, the population of Europe almost doubled to 1,800. They all needed food, homes, and jobs. There was not enough for everyone. They then migrated for jobs and to avoid hunger. Greeks, Portuguese, and Armenians also migrated hoping for new lives for them and their families. People even came because America had religious freedom. People from Holland and Jew who were from Germany, Poland, or Russia. Jews were often hurt or arrested for their beliefs. They figured they would at least have a chance here in America. In total, 26 million immigrates had come to America in a 50 year period.

 

In the 1800's, America had many improvements. They called these "pulls". They are features that attract you to people and to socialize. Transportation was a big deal once it improved. They had just created the first railroad. This made it easier to transport resources like silver and lumber from West to East. People were also allowed to travel on the trains. Traveling was now faster and easier. Later there ere trains that could take people straight to boats. Transportation improved even more when the steamship was invented. Migrating to America would usually take months, but now the trip was much faster. News was hard to get around. In 1844, the telegraph was invented. This just made the news travel faster. America really improved over the years!

 

Although migrating to America helped a lot of people, there were, however, challenges. They called these "pushes". These included rough environments, wars, poverty, and other problems. These conflicts worsened once the population in Europe increased. Europeans left due to harsh environments. Russian Jews escaped from prejudice,  persecution, and violent attacks. Southern Italians faced high birth rates and farming loses because of lower prices.

 

In 1848, gold was found along the American River in California by John Sutter. Although he tried to keep it a secret, it soon got out to the people of San Francisco. Many of them left to go to the river. It later spread through the rest of America. By the beginning of 1849, thousands of people were taken by ship to the river. The California Gold Rush had begun. More than 70,000 hopeful adventurers, called the "Forty-Niners", which had 325 Chinese men among them. This may have seemed like a "pull", but was also a "push". Soon the Chinese government raised taxes which made farmers have to sell their land because they could not pay for it. The population had started growing quickly. Soon they could not produce enough rice to feed the people, especially when it flooded. Many Chinese people joined the Gold Rush. This helped fix the problems.

Gold was discovered along the American River in California at 1848 on property of  John Sutter. He tried to keep the gold a secret but word got out that there was gold in the American River. By January of 1849, 60 ships and thousands of immigrants were headed for California. The Gold Rush had begun! More than 70,000 hopeful adventurers arrived in California in 1849 for the Gold Rush. Among these "Forty-Niners" were 325 men from China.

 

Some of these Chinease immigrants were fleeing from conflicts and poverty. In the middle of the 1800s, Guangdong was involved in a war between China and Britain. The 325 Chinease who joined the gold rush in 1849 were just the beginning. The next year the Chinease arrived in California. Then suddenly they came in great numbers:2,716 in 1851, and 20,026 in 1852. By 1870, there were 63,000 Chinease in the United States.

New Life in America

 

   In the 1800s, working people who build, farm, invent came to America in ships. There was a lot of new technology in 1800s so there was plenty for them to do. Lots of them were needed in factories, to farm and build on land, and to invent things.

 

   Germans were the largest group of immigrants in 1800s, then the Irish. Before the American Civil war started, one-fourth of the whole Irish population came to America. Which means there were 1.7 million Irish men, women, and children. Many Irish were desperate, there was a food shortage.

 

Later in the 1800s, other people from European countries started to arrive in America. Including Sweden, Italy, Denmark, Poland, Russia, and Hungary. All of those people needed food, homes, and jobs.And mostly to avoid hunger.

 

Others came for religious freedom, such as Holland and Jews from other European countries. Still others came to escape wars, that made their lives harmful, and unstable.

 

26 million immigrants came to the United States over a 50 year period! They came for a chance of freedom, and a change in their lives.

 

 

                            Pushes and Pulls

 

The first railroad that crossed America was completed in 1869, this meant that resources would lumber form the West, to East. People would travel on these trains too, it made one trip from one place to another easier and faster.

 

People became more aware about the changes and world around them. With the ability to move along distances easily, they took advantage of it. Most reasons why they moved often were " Pushes" and "Pulls." Pushes were things that drove people away, like harsh environment, wars, and other conflicts. Pulls were things that attracted people, for example: jobs, wealth, opportunities, and perceived freedoms.

 

Many of the new Europeans immigrants wanted to escape the horrible conditions in Europe. Southern Italians wanted to escape their sufferment from high birth rates and farming losses due to the low prices. Greeks, Poles, Hungarians, and Portuguese also moved. They ( As well as other immigrants ) hoped to make a better living for their families and themselves in the United States

 

                                       Gold Rush!

 

There are a lot of pulls for the immigrants as may already know, but one of the most biggest pulls for the immigrants was the California Gold Rush! Many of the Chinese moved to join the California gold rush. The gold was discovered in 1848 along the American River in California. The property was owned by John Sutter, even though Sutter kept the secret to himself, the word spread to San Francisco and once the new spread all over the United States, and to other countries all over the world, hundreds of people left the city to go join the gold rush!

 

  More than 70,000 hopeful adventures came to California in 1849. Among of these Forty-Niners were 325 for China! More Chinese came year after year! The Chinese hope they find some fortune in the California hills.

Moving to America

 

          Moving to America is very difficult, but can be very fortunate once you get there. America is full with new jobs, different religions, different languages, and much more exciting things.

          In the 1800s, there were many immigrants that came from all over the world. Some came from Poland, Germany, Ireland, Russia, Italy, Denmark, China, and a lot of other places.

          People came to America for freedom, wealth, a new environment, a new life, to escape wars, jobs, opportunities, avoid hunger, crops, and other things.

          Wealth was one thing that brought very many people to America. For example, in 1848 there was a big gold rush in California. A big amount of people from China came to the gold rush. One year after another, the population of the Chinese going to the U.S. raised higher and higher. Many people from China came to find many different things, but 77% of them were in California.

           Another reason why there were so many immigrants coming were because of people getting out of wars or fights. People were coming to find a new life, without violence. Would you want to live in a place being attacked by bombs, or being beat because of what religion you choose? I don't think anyone would! That's why people came to America! They found safe homes for themselves, and their children.

           Jews were getting mistreated because of their religion. Everyone is different in some way, so don't treat them differently! People from China came to America to get away from conflicts and poverty. China had 2 wars against Britain in their country. No one wants to live through that! China also had rebellions against their own government! Or they had village or family fights! Who in their right mind would want that in their village? Those are a couple reasons of why the Chinese came to America. Also, when they came to America, they got what they wanted!

     People also came because they couldn't pay taxes or their bills. Farmers who couldn't pay their taxes had to sell their land. Where are we going to go? the farmers thought. The only place they could think of was America. They got their land and were happy with it. That's what America is all about... making people happy.

Immigrants

 

   

 

    Most immigrants that came to America were from Germany. There was a lot of technology for them to use. They needed to work in factories, farms, build on land, and invent things. Immigrants did that.

 

    One- fourth of the whole Irish population came to America before the Civil War. That was 1.7 million Irish men, women, and children. The Irish were desperate because in Ireland crops failed, the potato crop was low, and there was a food shortage. One million Irish people died of starvation.

 

    In the later 1800s, people came from Russia, Italy, Poland, Denmark, Sweden, and Hungary. The extra people needed food, homes, and jobs, There wasn't enough in Europe.

 

    Others came for religious reasons. These people were from Holland, and the Jews who came from Germany, Poland, and Russia. The Jews were mistreated because of their beliefs in their home countries. But, people still came to escape wars that made their life unstable and unpredictable.

 

    The total number of immigrants that migrated to the United States was 26 million over a 50 year time period. Most knew very little about America except that it was a land of freedom and chance to work.

 

    The second half of the 1800s was a great change in America. Industries grew and a lot of immigrants came to Americas shores.

 

    Many European immigrants wanted to escape harsh conditions in Europe. Russian Jews had left to escape prejudice and persecution in the shape of pograms. Pograms were organized violent attacks.

 

    The Gold Rush started in 1848 along the American River in California. John Sutter discovered it. John tried to keep the gold a secret but the word of the find soon reached San Francisco and hundreds of people left the city to set off for the American River. Quickly, the news spread to the rest of the United States and to other parts of the world. By January of 1849, 60 ships with thousands of travelers were going to California.

 

     More than 70,000 adventurers arrived in California in 1849. These " Forty- Niners" were 32 men from China. More Chinese people came over the next year, and the eastern United States. The Chinese people hoped to find a fortune of gold waiting for them in the California Hills.

 

      Most of the first wave of the Chinese migrants were from Guangdong. Guangdong was in area on China's south coast. They were leaving from conflicts and poverty.  In the middle of the 1800s, Guangdong was in two wars between China and Britain. There was also many rebellions against the government and endless village and family feuds. So, the Chinese government raised taxes. The farmers were unable to pay their taxes so they had to sell their land.

 

    The 325 Chinese that had joined the gold rush in 1849 were just the beginning. Over the next year, 450 Chinese came to California. Then suddenly the came in huge numbers. 2,716 in 1851. 20,026 in 1852. By 1870, there were 63,000 i the United States.

Immigration

 

    Migrating from one country to another is very difficult. There are many advantages and disadvantages for moving to another country. Some advantages are that your country might have a food shortage so you could move to a different country that doesn't have a food shortage, there might be a really bad disease going around that's deadly and you wouldn't want to get it, or there might be a better job opportunity. Some disadvantages are: moving to a different country could be hard because you would have to sacrifice leaving family and friends, finding a job or a way to get money, not knowing the same language as the people in the country that you moved to, transportation, or the different time and climate changes that your body isn't used to. Now, lets see how people in the 1800s managed to do this, and why.

    In the 1800s, many people migrated to America. There were many reasons why they did. Some did so that they could build, farm, or invent new things. The largest group of immigrants were the Germans, and then the Irish. Many of the Irish people migrated to America just before the Civil War, there was about 1.7 million families that came at this time. They came because there was a food shortage in Ireland so people were dieing. Many other countries came to America for this reason as well. Some other people came because of there religious beliefs[the Jews] because they were mistreated because of what they believed in.

    In the later 1800s, America started to have many changes. Many things started to improve, and many more things were invented. Transportation improved, the telephone was invented,and printing books and newspaper became less expensive. Then, in the mid 1800s, gold was soon discovered.  In the next year people from everywhere around the United States and other countries heard about it and soon went to California for gold. This is when the Gold Rush began.

    So, this is how and why immigrants migrated to America in the 1800s. For gold, jobs, because of prejudice people in there country, and many other reasons. So, now we know why all this happened!

Why People Moved to America in the 1800s

    

     Although immigrating groups to the United States was a difficult journey in the 1800s, many people uprooted themselves and moved here. People had different reasons, but these are the main reasons they moved all over the globe to the U.S.A specifically.

 

     Before the American Civil War in the 1860s, 1.7 million+ people came to America before and after the war. The Irish were desperate because their crops failed and because they had a food shortage, a million people died of starvation. In the later 1800s, European countries that hadn't sent many people to America before kept on coming to America. The population doubled in Europe. All the extra people needed food, homes, and jobs so they came to America because Europe didn't have enough. Other people from Holland, Poland, Russia, and Jews from Germany came for religious freedom. In total, twenty six million immigrants arrived in the United States over a fifty year period.

 

     The second half of the 1800s was a great time of change for America. Industry grew and many new immigrants arrived on America's shores. Transportation improved, like the first railroad that crossed the United States was completed in 1869. So people can move to places faster. The invention of the telegraph in 1844 made news travel faster. People became more aware of the world around them and with the ability to move long distances easily, they moved more than ever. The harsh environment, wars, and other conflicts, and poverty drove people away. Jobs, wealth, opportunities, access to resources, and perceived freedoms attracted people.

Many people have immigrated to America over the past decades. People from Germany, Ireland, Russia, Italy, Poland, Denmark, Sweden, and Hungary were some of the many immigrants who came to America hoping to seek a new life. Immigrants came for the land, food, people, jobs, or maybe even just to get away from disasters.

 

In the 1800s, the two largest groups of immigrants who came to America were from Germany and Ireland. Next to the Germans, the Irish were the largest immigrant group, one-fourth of the people from Ireland came to America. They kept coming during and after the Civil War. In the later 1800s, more people from Europe arrived to America to find work and to avoid hunger. Other immigrants came for religious freedom like the Jews.

 

The second half of the 1800s was a time of great changes for America. Industry grew and many immigrants arrived. American transportation improved after the first railroad was built. It became easier to travel and to ship resources to other places. There was also a rapid change in how quickly messages traveled. Steam power and the redesigning of the print press made it possible to print books and newspapers. The invention of the telegraph in 1844 and the telephone in 1876 was also a big improvement.

 

In 1848 gold was discovered along the American River in California and hundreds of people set for the American River. By January, ships of thousands of travelers were heading for California.

Many of the people hoping to strike it rich were Chinese immigrants. By 1870, there were 63,000 Chinese in the United States but 77% of them were in California.

There many information about when, why, and how immigrants from other countries came to America. I would like to recognize stories of immigrants who immigrated over the last 200 years. Several facts and information will be explained why immigrants immigrated to America in the following article.

     During the 1800s, many immigrants immigrated to America to escape slavery, finding opportunities, and religious cultures. Before the American Civil War in the 1800s, one fourth of the whole population of Ireland came to America. Ireland crops had failed, especially potato crops, which caused more than one million people starve. In the later 1800s, people started to come to America to find jobs, avoid hunger, find homes, and find opportunities. Other immigrants came for religious freedom that included Holland and Jews. In total, over  26 million immigrants arrived in America over a 50 year period. This information would explain why immigrants immigrated to America.

     The secong half of the 1800s was a great time in America because their industries grew and many immigrants arrived in the U.S. As industries improved, transportation improved as well. Many workers completed the first railroad that crossed the United States at 1816, which caused to attract many immigrants to travel to America. Also, this meant that it was easier to move food stocks, lumber, and other resources. Travelers now could catch a train to America or ride a boat. Soon the population of America rapidly changed and widely information traveled. Steam power was soon invented and the printing press made it possible to print inexpensive books. Then, people became aware that they could get jobs, wealth, opportunities, and develop resources. Some immigrants fro Europe wanted to escape harsh conditions and moved to America. Russian Jews left there homes to  escape prejudice and persecution. There are much more reasons why immigrants immigrated to America, but these some main reasons why.

     Soon, gold was discovered in 1848 along the American River in California by John Sutter. Sutter kept his discovery a secret, but the word soon got out that gold was discovery. Other parts of the world found out that gold was discovered in San Francisco in California, so people quickly reached California to find wealth, which caused the Gold Rush. The Gold Rush was mostly involved with the Chinese. The Gold Mountain stories were spread throughout China and caused the Chinese to join the Gold Rush. As the Chinese arrived at California, the population of California increased by 77% and most of them were Chinese. Immigrant Explanatory Performance Test

  

 

      Most immigrants knew it would be a hard journey to get to America but they still made the hard trip because they knew they would have a better life in America than they would wherever they were before.

      Germans made up the largest amount of immigrants. Beside the Germans, the Irish were the population. Before the Civil War, 1/4 of the Irish population was in America.

(that is 1.7 million Irish families with men, women, and children) In Ireland, the crops failed. Especially the potato crop. More than 1 million people died of starvation in Ireland. In the 2nd half of the 1800s, p-people started coming from other European countries like Russia, Italy, Poland, Denmark, Sweden, and Hungary. Many Europeans came to America to avoid starvation. Others came for relkigious freedom. Like Holland, and Jews from Germany, Polland, and Russia.

Party in the U.S.A.

 

       Many immigrants came to the United States in the 1800s, but why? They came because of pushes and pulls, or things that forced them to come, and things that lured them into coming. The pushes and pulls include harsh conditions and the finding of gold. Lots of immigrants came to the United States for these reasons!

 

       One push reason causing immigrants to come to the United States were caused by of harsh conditions in Europe. Russian Jews left to escape "organized violent attacks." Italians went through harsh farming losses due to lower prices. Even the tradition of giving the land to the first baby boy was a mistake, since it left younger siblings landless! Hungarians, Greeks, Poles, Portuguese, and Armenians also moved, hoping to make a new life for themselves and their families in the United States. Europeans experience harsh conditions in the 1800s.

 

       A pull reason that attracted people was gold. After gold was discovered in 1848 by John Sutter, it attracted huge amounts of immigrants. 70,000 hopeful adventurers came to California in 1849, and 325 of those men were from China. More and more Chinese came as the years went by, hoping to strike rich. Due to this event, by the 1870s, there were almost 65,000 Chinese in the U.S. What makes it even more amazing is the fact that there were only 2,716 in 1851. Gold clearly attracted immigrants.

 

       As you can see, immigrants settled in the United States by pushes and pulls. The Europeans were forced to by harsh conditions, while the Chinese were attracted by the chance of sudden wealth. People in the United States need to be thankful for these events, for without them, where would we be without them?

I think that the immigrants moved to the United states in the 19th century for many reasons. There were things people wanted to be a part of, and also things they were trying to escape. America was seeming better and better by the day!

 

        Some people came here to escape from harsh conditions in their home country. For instance, as it says in "Moving to America" by Joy Hakim, "The Irish were desperate because in Ireland crops had failed, especially the potato crop." This was starving the Irish people, so many of them came here for food. But food was not the only problem. From the same article, "Others came for religious freedom. These included people from Holland and Jews who came from Germany, Poland, and Russia." Many of the people moving here were mistreated in their home countries and came for freedom.

 

        Other immigrants came here to seek wealth and happiuness. To quote an excerpt from a book on immigrants by Ronald Takaki "Gold Rush! Chinese move to California," "Like the people who came from the eastern United States, the Chinese hoped to find a fortune waiting for them in the California hills." Many people looking for money came here to California for the gold rush. Not only the Chinese, but "70,000 hopeful adventurers" settled down in California during this time.

 

        Still more people just wanted to get a taste of everything going on in America. It helped that "The invention of the telegraph in 1844 and telephone in 1876 only made news travel faster." ("Changes in America: The 'Pushes' and 'Pulls' for Immigrants") There was now news about everything great in America travelling at high speed everywhere. "The second half of the 1800s was a time of great change in America." Who wouldn't want great change? America is starting to pull ahead insustrially, and everyone else wants a part of it.

During the late 1800s many people left for America. People from all over the world came to live in The United States of America. Over 1.7 million people from Ireland left their homes to live here. There was about 200,000 more tons of coal produced in 1910 than in 1860. Between the years 1860 and 1910 America grew; a lot.

 

 

Between 1860 and 1910  travel was easier along with many other things. There were about 8 times as many miles of railroad tracks. This shows that there was a big improvement in the ease of traveling. This is important because if travel didn't get easier the west coast might not be American territory. About 9 times the number of daily newspapers existed. This shows that printing got a lot easier. This is important because, there would probably be less papers today if printing didn't get easier.

 

The gold rush made America grow, in a big way. The gold rush brought many people to California, "more than 70,000 hopeful adventurers arrived in CCalifornia in 1849." This shows that this helped the USA grow. This is important because the US would be a very different place. Many Chinese left there homes for California, "by 1880 there were more than 63,000 Chinese in the US." This shows how much the gold rush made the USA grow. This is important because the Chinese are a big percentage of our population.

 

Over the course of 50 years America grew in many ways.  Many more resources were used in 1910 than in 1860. Over 27 million people left for America in 50 years. Europeans, Italians, Irish, Chinese, German and many more ethnic groups came to America for many resons.

Cultural Heritage of the European Immigration

 

During the last 200 years, there was a big immigration. The Europeans built a boat to migrate to America. The Europeans wanted to migrate to America because they knew they would have a better life. Also, some of the Europeans came for freedom, religious freedom, foods and crops. Germans made up the largest single immigrant group in the 1800s. Next to the Germans, the Irish were the largest immigrant group. Before the American Civil War in the 1860s, one-fourth of the whole population of Ireland came to America. (That was 1.7 million Irish men, woman, and children.) they kept coming, during and after the war. The Irish were so desperate because in Ireland, crops had failed, especially the potato crop. There was a food shortage. More than 1 million people died of starvation in Ireland. In the later 1800s, people started coming from other European countries that had not sent many people to America before. This included Russia, Italy, Poland, Denmark, Sweden, and Hungary. The population of Europe doubled between 1750 and 1850.

 

      Next, there was great a change in America. Industry grew and many immigrants arrived on America's shores. Transportation improved. The first railroad that crossed the United States was completed in 1869. This meant that it became easier and easier to move resources like silver and lumber from the West to the East. People could travel on these trains too. A trip from one place to another became shorter and easier for many people. A trip to America in earlier times would have taken months, but new steamships could make the trip much faster. These advances in transportation made it possible for more people to travel more easily.

 

     Gold was discovered in 1848 along the American River in California, on the property of  a man named John Sutter. Although Sutter tried to keep the discovery a secret, word of the find soon reached San Francisco, and hundered of people left the city to set off for the American River. The news spread to the  rest of the United States, and to other parts of the world as well.  By January of 1849, 60 ships and thousand of overland travelers were head for California. The California gold rush had begun. More than 70,000 hopeful adventures arrived in California in1849. Among these "Forty-Niners" were 325 men from China. More Chinese cam ethe next year, and the next. Like  the people who came from waiting for them in the Califoria hills.

Immigration Explanitory Preformance Task

Immigration to America in the 1800's

 

Imagine yourself in Europe, it is 1850, and many people including you and you family are in need of food and a job. What would you do? Many people decided to move to America.

Many people immigrated to America in the 1800's including people from Europe, China, and other countries. They came for a variety of reasons, such as promises of food, shelter, jobs, freedom, hope, and after the Gold Rush started, some came to find gold.

 

The Europeans made up a  very large group of the immigrants coming to America in the 1800's. Europe's population doubled between 1750 and 1850, so many were in need of food, shelter, and jobs. An Article called Moving to America by Joy Hakim states that many Europeans moved to America to Avoid hunger.

Those were not the only reasons why they moved to America, though. Some came to seek religious freedom. Some of these people included the Jewish people, who came from Germany, Russia, and Poland. They were often times discriminated and mistreated for their beliefs and religion.

 

Another group of people who came to America in the 1800's were the Chinese. They mainly kept their eye on California, where they hoped to get rich after the Gold Rush started in 1849. As it says in the article Gold Rush! Chinese Move to California, the Chinese called California Gam Saan, or "Gold Mountain." They heard about all the gold that was found there, and they craved to go to "Gold Mountain", find a fortune, and return to China with their riches. According to the same source, 77% of the 63,000 Chinese  who lived in America in 1780 were living in California.

Some other reasons why the Chinese came to America could be to escape the oppressive government and the extensive village and family fights. In the mid-1800's, Guangdong was also involved in two wars between Britain and China.

 

The industry grew and transportation was improved in America in the second half of the 1800's. The first railroad to cross the United States was completed in 1869, and that meant resources such as silver and lumber could become more widely available. The redesigning of the printing press, steam power, the telegraph, and the telephone also helped information travel more quickly and widely. These things attracted immigrants too.

 

As you can see, many people from China and Europe emigrated from their own countries and went to America for with their own reasons; from seeking religious freedom to finding gold. The number of  people born outside the United States who were living there went from just over four million to over thirteen million from 1860 to 1910, just a fifty year period! America was the target for many people seeking a new start in the 1800's.

During the 1800s, working people who could bulid ,farm,or invent came to America in a ship after ship after ship.Germans made up the largest single group of immigrants in the 1800s.Before the American civil war in the 1860s, one-fourth of the whole population of Ireland came to America.

 

In the later 1800s, people started coming from other European countries that had not sent many people to America before.More than 70,000 hopeful adventurers arrived in California in 1849.

 

Gold was discovered in 1848 along the American river in California, on the property of a man named John Sutter.Although Sutter tried to keep the discovery of people left the city to set off for the American river.The news spread to the rest of the United States,and to other parts of the world as well.By January of 1849, 60 ships and thousands of overland travelers were headed for California. The Calfornia gold rush had begun.

 

Most of this first wave of Chinse migrants came from Guangdong, an area on China's south coast.In the middle of the 1800s, Guangdong was involved in two was between China and Britain.

Later the European countries started to move here. this included Russia, Italy, Poland, Denmark, Sweden, and Hungary. The U.S. had to start making new jobs for these people. 26 million immigrants had come to the U.S. in a fifty year period.

In the 1800s, people who could build, farm, or invent came to America in ship after ship. With their new technology, there was plenty of work they could do. they were needed to work in the new factories, farm, build on land, and invent things. The immigrants did it all.

 

Most immigrants moved more than ever because of what they call "pushes" and "pulls." A push are the features of life that drive people from their homes. They include harsh environments, wars and other conflicts and poverty. A pull are the features of life that attract people. these include jobs, wealth, opportunities, access to resources, and perceived freedoms.

 

Many of the European immigrants wanted to escape harsh conditions in Europe. Russian Jews left to escape prejudice and persecution, in the form of Pogroms. Southern Italians suffered high birth rates and farming losses due to lower prices. The tradition of leaving their family to the first-born male often left younger siblings without land. Hungarians, Greeks, Poles, Portuguese, and Armenians also moved. The Immigrants hoped to make a better life for their families and themselves in the United States.

Moving to America in the 1800's

Written By: Tricia Happel

 

 

     In the 1800's many people immigrated to the America's. Some of these people included: German's, Irish, Russian's,Italians, Pole's, Denmark's, Swedish, Hungarian, Jews, Holland, Greek's,  Portuguese, Armenians, and Chinese. There were "pushes" and "pulls" to come to America.As you can tell, America was a growing country!

      Germans then Irish were the 2 largest immigrant groups. They were coming because of war,failing crops,food shortages,and starvation.America had plenty of good soil for these people because most of it hadn't been used yet. They couldn't starve and die with all of the food being grown.Later in the 1800's, European countries were sending people that hadn't before. All of these people coming needed: jobs, food, and shelter. There was lots of undeveloped land that could be used to put up shops and even makes houses.

       Other immigrants were coming to find religious freedom. Mainly Jews, because they were mistreated for their religious beliefs in their countries. Life that was unstable made many others move to America.About 26 million people came to America in near 50 years!Many saw America as a land of freedom and opportunity.

         Gold Rush! Gold Rush! Read all about it! In 1848 John Sutter discovered gold on his home estate in California. Since he found all of this gold, news spread around. Many Chinese moved to California searching for gold. Most of the Chinese came from Guangdong, trying to get away from poverty and war conflicts. And even many rebellions against the government, and raised taxes.Once they struck gold, and collected it, they went back home.

          There were multiple reasons people moved to America. Like, searching for gold, religious freedom, food, shelter,etc. America made hopes and dreams for many people, but not everyone got what they wanted.By 1970 ,63,000 Chinese moved to the us, so imagine how many total people moved to America-that's a lot! From 1860-1910, 60,874,000  people moved to America! Now we now how important America was to people without many opportunities.

During the 1800s, working people who could do various things came to America in ships. With all the new technology there was plenty for them to do.

The Germans and the Irish came in the largest groups. Before the Civil War, one-fourth of the Irish population came to America. They kept coming to America, even after the war, because their crops had failed, even the potato crop, causing a food shortage. More than one million died of starvation in that period of time.

In the later 1800s, more immigrants came from all over countries in Europe, such as Russia, Iraly, Sweden, and other countries. Many Europeans came to America to find work and avoid hunger.

Others came for religious freedom.

In total, about 26 million immigrants arrived in the U.S. over a 50 year period.

In the second half of the 1800s, transportation improved. The first railroad that crossed the United States was completed in 1869. It made it easier to move resources like lumber and silver from the East to the West. People could travel by trains too. Taking a trip by train made traveling shorter and easier for many people.

People discovered that steam power and the redesign of the printing press made it possible to print inexpensive books and newspapers. The invention of the telegraph in 1844 and telephone in 1876 made news travel even faster.

Gold was discovered along the American River in California in 1848. Although the people of the discovery tried to keep it a secret, word got around very fast, starting the California Gold rush.
Over the last 200 years many immigrants have come to America.

In the 1800's, people came to the U.S. because for food,

religious reasons, harsh conditions, wars, jobs, and much more. Here's why certain groups of immigrants moved to America.

Around 1860 in Ireland, a lot of crops didn't grow, resulting in

food shortage. Irish people came to America because of this and after that kept coming. Later on in the 1800's, people from Russia, Italy, Poland, Denmark, Sweden, and Hungary came to the U.S. because of need of food, houses, and jobs that there wasn't enough of in Europe. The people who didn't come for jobs, homes, or foods, came for religious reasons or to escape horrible wars.

A lot of Europeans wanted to get away from harsh conditions

in Europe so they came to America. Russian Jews escaped in pogroms from prejudice and persecution. Italians in the south had high birth rates and farming loss because of lower prices, which caused them to start their lifes over in the U.S.

In 1849, tons of Chinese people came to the U.S. to find gold

that had been found a year earlier. But some Chinese came because of problems with wars and poverty. People rebelled against the government. There was endless village and family fighting. Their government raised taxes, which caused farmers not able to pay them have to sell land. During all of this in Guangdong, China, the population was growing rapidly and the area couldn't grow enough food to give the people since the crops were getting flooded.

Of course all of this immigration caused the population to

increase. In 1860 the population was 31,513,000. By 1910 the population had almost tripled to 92,407,000. But the population wasn't the only thing to increase. The number of people who lived in cities in 1860 was more than 6 million and by 1910 was almost 42 million! The number of people born outside of the U.S. in 1860 was a little over 4 million and was up to 13 million in 1910. The coal collected in 1860 was almost 20.5 million tons. In 1910 more than 417 million tons was collected. That's more than 6 times the amount collected in 1860!! The miles of railroad track in 1860 was 30,626 and 240,293 in 1910. The number of daily newspapers in 1860 was 387 and was up to 2,600 in 1910. All of these things increased a lot in 50 years- and a lot of it was because of immigrates!

Germans were the largest group to immigrate to the U.S. in the 1800s. The second largest group is the Irish, one/fourth of the whole population came to get away from war. In he later 1800s people from Europe started immigrating to the U.S. People from Russia, Italy, Poland, Denmark, Sweden, and Hungary also came to the U.S. around this time. All of these European people needed food, homes, and jobs, because there wasn't enough in Europe.

 

 

                     

 

 

                    The second half of the 1800s was a time that everything changed in America. Americas industry grew and many more immigrants arrived on America's shores. One of the first railroads that crossed the united states was completed in the 1869. This made it easier to move resources like silver and lumber from the West to East. Having this railroad also made it easier for people to travel to far distances and make the tip shorter. If you want to take a train right to a boat you can and the trip wouldn't be as long as it would have been without the railroad. A trip to America in the earlier times the trip would have taken a very long time, but no with all the technology the trip would have been much much faster.

 

 

 

 

 

                   In the 1800s, there was also a rapid and important change in how quickly an widely information traveled. Now with a steam power and the redesign of the printing press made it possible to print many inexpensive books and newspapers. This made news and ideas available to more people. The telegraph invention in 1844 and the telephone in 1876 made news travel faster. With the ability to move long distances fast and easily, people moved more than ever before. The reason why they are moving more than ever is because of  "pushes" and "pulls".  Pushes are those ways of life that kick people out of their homes. those reasons include harsh environments, wars, and many other conflicts, and poverty. Pulls are the features of life that attract people, such as, jobs, wealth, opportunities, access to resources, and perceived freedoms.

Immigration Stories

     

     For Cultural Heritage Day, my school is recognizing the stories of how the immigrants arrived to America. Immigrants came to America for many reasons. Some were "pushed" to America by conflicts and harsh enviroment; while others were "pulled" to America by the religious freedom and many  jobs. I would like to explain how these immigrants came to America and their stories.

     Imagine this: you are a German child living in a world with harsh weather, no religious freedom, and tons of conflict. Your family cannot take your country anymore and decides to leave Germany for America. In this situation you are being "pushed" to America. Irish immigrants were "pushed" from their country due to crops failing and a shortage of food. After that, many other Europeans left to go to America so they didn't die of starvation. Other immigrants also left for religious freedom because America was known as the land of freedom. Some immigrants left their home countries to escape the war and find jobs. Over fiftey years 26 million immigrants were in the US. A majority of the immigrants were "pushed" to America.

     Imagine this: you are living in China, when word comes to you that in America there is riches beyond your belief. You pack your stuff and buy the next ticket to America, the land of freedom. In this case, you are being "pulled" to America. Many immigrants left for America because of all the oppourtunities to become famous and rich. At this time, most of the inventors were immigrants. Famous scientist, Albert Einstien was an immigrant from Germany searching for a job. Many of the Chinese sailed to America because of the gold rush in California. Other immigrants left for jobs to support their family. Lots of immigrants were "pulled" by America's jobs and riches.

     After reading this passage you will be able to understand why immigrants came to America and their stories. When immigrants came the population flourished and the amount of production blasted up. Before immigration, not a lot of people were born outside of America, but after immigration a majority of the population was born outside of the US. I think immigration truley made a majoe impact on the united states.

Moving to America

           People moved to America in the 1800s for a few reasons. One of the reasons was, there was the California Gold Rush. Many people from China decided to immigrate to America for gold.

            Another reason people moved to America is, transportation improved. The first railroad in the United States was completed in 1869. This made it easier to transport resources such as, silver. These trains and other new transportation made it easier for people to transport things and to travel easier.

             The new print press design made more print books and newspapers less expensive. This made people more aware of news and ideas in the United States.

               Another reason people immigrated to the United States in the 1800s is, there was much more new technology, factories, farms, and to invent things such as, the telephone. Some people immigrated to the United States because they were trying to avoid leading to starvation.

                 Some people even came to the United States for religious freedom. America was known as the land of freedom. They came because what they wanted was, freedom and work. They needed a chance to work. They also came to America for coal production.

                  Some people came to America because their crops failed and there was a food shortage. Some people came for homes. Some people came to America to escape wars that led them to an unstable life.

                   A lot of people came for wealth, and opportunities. They would have better access to resources and harsh conditions. They also came so they wouldn't have violent attacks. They all came for a new life for family and themselves in America in some way.

In the 1800's, many people moved to America to find work, freedom, and many other reasons.  Others, like the gold rush, were used for greed and pride, not for survival.  In this paper, I will talk about why the immigrants came, for good or bad.

 

     Many people from all over the world came to America during the Civil War and before.  Over all, the Germans made up the largest single group of all of the immigrants in America.  Right behind them, was the Irish. In the 1860's, one-fourth of Ireland's entire population came to America right before the Civil War.  SO many of them came because the crops in all of Ireland had failed, especially the potatoes.  Of the ones that didn't come to America, the three-fourths, 1 million men, women, and children died of starvation at that time.

 

       Russia, Italy, Poland, Denmark, Sweden, and Hungary, all European countries, sent many people to America.  Before that, the population of Europe had rapidly increased, almost doubled, between the years of 1750 and 1850.  All of those people needed food, homes, and jobs, which were running very low.

 

Others came for freedom, which included people from Holland, German Jews, (Who were badly mistreated for their beliefs in Germany.)  Poland, and Russia, but there were still some who wanted to escape wars that ruined some people's lives and were unpredictable.

The first railroad that crossed the United States was completed in 1869. This meant that it became easier and easier to move resources like silver and lumber from the West to the East. These advances in transportation made it possible for more people to travle more easily. Gold was discovered in 1848 along the American River in California, on the property of a man named John Sutter. Although sutter tried to keep the discovery a secret, word of the find soon reached San Francisco, and hundred of people left the city to set off for the American River. The news spread to the rest of the United States, and to other parts of the world as well. By January of 1849, 60 ships and thousands of overland travelers were headed for California. The California  gold rush, had begon.  The 325 Chinese who joined the gold rush in 1849 were just the biginning. The next year, 450 more Chinese arrived in California. Then suddenly they came in greater numbers: 2,716 in 1851, and 20,026 in 1852. By 1870, there were 63,000 Chinese in the United States, and they had played a critical part in building the first transcontinental the country,77% of them were in California.

Immigrants are basically people who move from one country to another for a better life. Moving from one country to another either from force or pleasure is referred to as Migration. Immigrant migrate either because they lost their jobs and are look for new ones or that they want to get away from war and conflict. During the last few centuries, migration to America has become more and more popular because America has lower unemployment rates, more money and product, and it just become better and better, Of course with all these things, word spread. And that's how it all started.

          In 1790's America was known as a brand new country. So, people took advantage of that. By the 1800's Immigrants were coming by ship loads, looking for jobs and money. The largest group of immigrants were Germans. Then There were the Irish. The Irish came to America because they were desperate for fertile land. Potato crop failed, so they decided to grow them somewhere else, so they came to the new land. LAter  in the 1800's other races of people came. Soon enough, every kind of person from Europe came to America. Russian, Italian, Polish, and others came to America. Jewish people were killed off in Germany, so to avoid conflict, they migrated to America. Later on in that century, going to America became fairly easier.

Imagine you live a life of poverty in the 1800s, and you find out that you can move to America and live a life of no poverty. Would you choose to stay or leave? This is the choice all people immigrating in the 1800s had to make. There are many reasons why people wanted to move to America in the 1800s. Some of them include the opportunities, freedoms, and what people can escape.

  If one were to move from a country to America, one reason why they would be doing it is because of the opportunities they would gain. Firstly, they would be giving their children the opportunity to live a life free of poverty and depression. This is important because they will be happy knowing that their children will have a chance to be rich and without the knowledge of terrible things, such as homelessness. Secondly, they would be able to get a job. Unlike their country, where it is usually nearly impossible to get a job, they will be equally able to get a job as that of the person sitting next to them. Lastly, the person will be able to gain the opportunity to become rich, just like the Chinese hoped. This is important because they will be able to, just like Source #3 says, "return proudly to China." Not only would the person gain many opportunities, but many freedoms too.

  To many people, freedom of many different things is extremely essential. This is one of the main reasons why people came to America. First of all, people would gain the freedom of religion. This is important because they will be able to practice their religious beliefs without having to worry about being punished. Second of all, they will gain the right to defend themselves in court. This is also important because in some countries, people aren't allowed to defend themselves and even if they are not guilty, they are sometimes sentenced to death. Last but not least, people will have the freedom to vote for their "leaders." Many people believe that it is important to be ruled by a fair leader, but when they are not able to vote, a cruel leader may come to power. People came to America in the 1800s for many reasons, one reason is because of what they can escape.

  When people come to America, they not only think of the opportunities and freedoms they will gain, but also what they will escape. For example, people who live during times of war can escape to America. This is important because they will not have to worry about being killed by a bomb or weapon. Another example is that people who live with a lot of siblings and their family can't provide enough food for them can move to America. In America, there will be enough food for that person and so they won't starve to death. One last example is that the people can escape poverty. Poverty is a horrible thing. People can die of illnesses because of dirty environments. But in America, there are certain rules about living conditions, and the environment won't be as harsh.

  Overall, there are many reasons why people moved to America from other countries such as the opportunites they would gain, the freedoms they would gain, and what they would escape.
